future_technology.title: Requirements Automation - Technology Roadmap
future_technology.description: A comprehensive overview of technologies required for full automation of requirements elicitation, analysis, and management.

1. sensory_systems.name: Advanced Computer Vision (Multi-Modal)
1. sensory_systems.description: Utilizes high-resolution cameras (RGB, depth, thermal), LiDAR, and potentially spectroscopic imaging to capture visual and physical context during stakeholder interactions, prototypes, and operational environments. Focuses on recognizing objects, gestures, facial expressions, and semantic understanding of the surrounding space.

accuracy_metrics.object_detection: ≥ 95% accuracy on common objects in industrial and office settings (ISO 19784 standard)
accuracy_metrics.gesture_recognition: ≥ 90% accuracy for core gestures (point, wave, etc.)
accuracy_metrics.facial_expression_recognition: ≥ 85% accuracy for common emotions (joy, sadness, anger, etc.)

specifications.resolution: 1920x1080 minimum for RGB cameras, 100mm LiDAR resolution

1. sensory_systems.name: Voice and Natural Language Processing (NLP) - Contextualized
1. sensory_systems.description: Sophisticated NLP models trained on vast datasets of requirements documents, stakeholder conversations, and process documentation. Crucially, incorporates contextual awareness – understanding the situation surrounding the conversation (e.g., physical environment, task being performed).  Moving beyond simple keyword extraction to true semantic understanding.

accuracy_metrics.intent_recognition: ≥ 92% accuracy for common requirements-related intents (e.g., 'add a requirement', 'modify a requirement')
accuracy_metrics.entity_extraction: ≥ 90% accuracy for extracting key entities (e.g., features, constraints, stakeholders)
accuracy_metrics.sentiment_analysis: ≥ 88% accuracy for detecting stakeholder sentiment related to requirements

1. sensory_systems.name: Haptic Feedback Systems
1. sensory_systems.description: Provides physical feedback to users and robotic systems, mimicking textures, forces, and pressures. Important for validating requirements related to physical products and systems.

2. control_systems.name: Reinforcement Learning (RL) - Requirements Optimization
2. control_systems.description: Utilizes RL algorithms to iteratively refine requirements based on simulated system behavior and stakeholder feedback.  Capable of exploring the requirement space and identifying optimal configurations.

specifications.environment_simulation_fidelity: High fidelity, incorporating system dynamics and stakeholder preferences

2. control_systems.name: Adaptive Control Systems
2. control_systems.description: Dynamically adjusts control parameters based on real-time sensor data and system behavior.  Essential for handling variability and uncertainty in the requirements process.

accuracy_metrics.tracking_error: ≤ 2% error in achieving target requirement values

3. mechanical_systems.name: Modular Robotic Platforms
3. mechanical_systems.description: Highly adaptable robotic arms and mobile platforms designed for data collection, prototype manipulation, and interaction with physical systems.  Focus on dexterity and precision.

3. mechanical_systems.name: Digital Twins - Physical Embodiment
3. mechanical_systems.description: Real-time synchronization of digital models with physical prototypes, enabling virtual testing and validation of requirements.

4. software_integration.name: Semantic Web Technologies - Knowledge Graph
4. software_integration.description: A central knowledge graph storing all requirements-related information (documents, conversations, prototypes, simulations).  Leverages ontologies and linked data to enable automated reasoning and inference.

accuracy_metrics.data_consistency: ≥ 99% data consistency across the knowledge graph

specifications.graph_size: Scalable to millions of nodes and edges

4. software_integration.name: Digital Thread Orchestration Platform
4. software_integration.description: A platform that integrates and manages all data generated throughout the requirements lifecycle, providing a single source of truth.

specifications.scalability: Handles large volumes of data and concurrent users

future_technology.5. timeline_estimate: Overall: 5-15 years (with significant acceleration driven by key research breakthroughs)
6. key_research_areas: Edge Computing for Real-Time Requirements Processing

input.system_message: You are an AI assistant specialized in forecasting future automation technologies. For the given topic, provide a comprehensive overview of technologies that would need to be created or refined to enable full automation in this field. Focus on realistic technological advancements that could be achieved in the next 5-15 years. For each technology, include specific technical specifications and accuracy metrics where appropriate.
input.user_message:
Create a detailed overview of future technologies needed for full automation of: Requirements Automation

Format your response as a JSON object with these categories:
1. sensory_systems: Array of sensing technologies with descriptions and accuracy metrics
2. control_systems: Array of control mechanisms and their capabilities
3. mechanical_systems: Array of physical components and their specifications
4. software_integration: Array of software technologies needed to coordinate everything
5. timeline_estimate: Estimated years until these technologies could be realized
